turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: Sarek... I would have come to Vulcan... to express my deepest sympathies...

turns.speaker: SAREK
turns.text: Spare me your human platitudes, Kirk. I have been to your Government. I have seen the Genesis information, and your own report.

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: Then you know how bravely your son met his death.

turns.speaker: SAREK
turns.text: "Met his death"?  How could you, his friend, have assumed that? Why did you leave him on Genesis! Spock trusted you -- and you denied him his future!

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: I -- saw no future --

turns.speaker: SAREK
turns.text: You missed the point, then and now... Only his body was "in death," Kirk! And you were the last one to be with him.

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: Yes, I was...

turns.speaker: SAREK
turns.text: Then you must know that you should have come with him to Vulcan.

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: But -- why?

turns.speaker: SAREK
turns.text: Because he asked you to! He entrusted you with his very essence -- with everything was not of the body. He asked you to bring him to us -- and to bring that which he gave you: his Katra. His living spirit.

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: Sir. Your son meant more to me than you can know. I'd have given my life if it would have saved his. You must believe me when I tell you that he made no request of me!

turns.speaker: SAREK
turns.text: He would not have spoken of it openly.

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: Then, how --

turns.speaker: SAREK
turns.text: Kirk, I must have your thoughts. May I join your mind?

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: Of course...!

turns.speaker: SAREK
turns.text: ... He spoke of your friendship.

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: Yes...

turns.speaker: SAREK
turns.text: He asked you not to grieve...

turns.speaker: SAREK
turns.text: ... The needs of the many outweigh...

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: ... The needs of the few...

turns.speaker: SAREK
turns.text: ... Or the one.

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: ... Spock...

turns.speaker: SAREK
turns.text: I have been... and always shall be... your friend. Live long... and prosper!

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: ... No...! ` Kirk, bathed with sweat, suddenly shudders in pain. Sarek opens his eyes, removes his hands. He touches Kirk with gentleness as Jim recovers, opens his eyes.

turns.speaker: SAREK
turns.text: Forgive me. It is not here. I assumed he had mind-melded with you. It is the Vulcan way when the body's end is near.

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: But he couldn't touch me...! We were separated!

turns.speaker: SAREK
turns.text: I see... and I understand.  Then everything that he was... Everything that he knew... is lost. And when I return home empty-handed, many shall mourn.

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: Please wait!... Surely he would have found a way! If there was so much at stake -- Spock would have found a way!

turns.speaker: SAREK
turns.text: Yes... But -- how...?

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: Sarek!... What if he melded with someone else?!

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: Bones!...

turns.speaker: SAREK
turns.text: One alive, one not. Yet both in pain.

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: What must I do?

turns.speaker: SAREK
turns.text: You must bring them to Mount Selaya -- on Vulcan. Only there is the passage possible. Only there can both find peace...

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: What you ask is difficult.

turns.speaker: SAREK
turns.text: You will find a way, Kirk. If you honor them both, you <U>must</U>.

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: What about Spock?

turns.speaker: SAREK
turns.text: I am not sure. Only time will answer.  Kirk. I thank you. What you have done is --

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: What I have done, I had to do.

turns.speaker: SAREK
turns.text: But at what cost? Your ship... Your son.

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: If I hadn't tried, the cost would have been my soul.

turns.speaker: KRUGE
turns.text: So!  Speak!

turns.speaker: TORG
turns.text: Great power... to control... dominate... destroy. If it works.

turns.speaker: KRUGE
turns.text: Share this with no one.

turns.speaker: TORG
turns.text: Understood, my lord.

turns.speaker: KRUGE
turns.text: We are going to this "planet." Even as our emissaries negotiate for "peace" with the Federation, we will <U>act</U> for the preservation of our race! We will seize the secret of this weapon. The secret of ultimate power!

turns.speaker: TORG
turns.text: Success, my lord.

turns.speaker: KRUGE
turns.text: Station!

turns.speaker: TORG
turns.text: Sir, may I suggest --

turns.speaker: KRUGE
turns.text: Say the wrong thing, Torg, and I will kill you too!

turns.speaker: TORG
turns.text: I only meant, my lord, that if it's prisoners you want --  There are life signs on the planet. Perhaps the very scientists you seek.

turns.speaker: KRUGE
turns.text: I ordered no interruptions.

turns.speaker: TORG
turns.text: But sir! Federation Starship approaching.

turns.speaker: TORG
turns.text: We are cloaked. Enemy closing on impulse power. Range, 5,000 Kellicams.

turns.speaker: KRUGE
turns.text: Good.  This is the turn of luck I have been waiting for.

turns.speaker: KRUGE
turns.text: Why haven't they finished us?... They outgun me ten to one; they have four hundred in crew to my handful, yet they sit there.

turns.speaker: TORG
turns.text: Perhaps they wish to take you prisoner.

turns.speaker: KRUGE
turns.text: They know we would die first.

turns.speaker: TORG
turns.text: How can you tell that?

turns.speaker: KRUGE
turns.text: I trust my instincts.  Admiral Kirk. This is your opponent speaking.

turns.speaker: KRUGE
turns.text: I give two minutes. For you, and your gallant crew.  Take every last man: form a boarding party, armed heavily!

turns.speaker: TORG
turns.text: They outnumber us, my Lord --

turns.speaker: KRUGE
turns.text: <U>We are Klingons</U>! Once you control the ship, I will transfer my flag there. And we will take Genesis from their own memory banks!

turns.speaker: KRUGE
turns.text: I'll be in my quarters. Execute course to the Federation Boundary.

turns.speaker: MALTZ
turns.text: Yes, my lord!

turns.speaker: MALTZ
turns.text: Range: 3000 Kellicams.

turns.speaker: KRUGE
turns.text: Steady. Continue on impulse power.

turns.speaker: MALTZ
turns.text: Firing range, sir.

turns.speaker: MALTZ
turns.text: 1,000 Kellicams, closing!

turns.speaker: KRUGE
turns.text: Wait!... Wait...

turns.speaker: MALTZ
turns.text: 500 Kellicams!

turns.speaker: MALTZ
turns.text: My Lord, enemy commander wishes a truce to confer.

turns.speaker: KRUGE
turns.text: Put him on screen!  Study him well.

turns.speaker: MALTZ
turns.text: My Lord... what are your orders?

turns.speaker: KRUGE
turns.text: I underestimated him... He did the one thing I didn't anticipate ... He destroyed himself...

turns.speaker: MALTZ
turns.text: Sir, may I --

turns.speaker: KRUGE
turns.text: Killing his son was <U>stupid</U>! It made Kirk willing to die.

turns.speaker: MALTZ
turns.text: We still have the prisoners, sir. Perhaps their information --

turns.speaker: KRUGE
turns.text: They are useless! It was Kirk I needed. And I let him slip away.

turns.speaker: MALTZ
turns.text: But surely, our mission has not failed -- ?

turns.speaker: KRUGE
turns.text: Our mission is over. I have failed... A human has been bolder and more ruthless than I...  That -- is the real dishonor.

turns.speaker: LIEUTENANT
turns.text: You amaze me, Commander.

turns.speaker: UHURA
turns.text: How is that...?

turns.speaker: LIEUTENANT
turns.text: A twenty year space veteran, yet you ask for the worst duty station in town. I mean, look at this place: the hind end of space.

turns.speaker: UHURA
turns.text: Peace and quiet appeals to me, Lieutenant.

turns.speaker: LIEUTENANT
turns.text: Well, maybe that's okay for someone like you whose career is winding down. But me: I need some challenge in my life. Some adventure... Even just a surprise or two.

turns.speaker: UHURA
turns.text: You know what they say, Lieutenant. Careful what you wish for: you may get it.

turns.speaker: LIEUTENANT
turns.text: Commander, these are some of the most famous people in Starfleet! Admiral Kirk, my God!

turns.speaker: UHURA
turns.text: Good for you, Lieutenant.

turns.speaker: LIEUTENANT
turns.text: But it's damn irregular. No destination orders, no encoded i.d...

turns.speaker: UHURA
turns.text: All true.

turns.speaker: LIEUTENANT
turns.text: Well -- what are we going to do about it?!

turns.speaker: UHURA
turns.text: I am going to do nothing about it. <u>You</u> are going to sit in the closet.

turns.speaker: LIEUTENANT
turns.text: The <u>closet</u>?! Have you lost all sense of reality?

turns.speaker: UHURA
turns.text: This isn't reality. This is fantasy.

turns.speaker: BONES
turns.text: But dear Lord, are we intelligent enough to -- Suppose, this thing were used where life already exists?

turns.speaker: SPOCK
turns.text: It would destroy such life in favor of its new matrix --

turns.speaker: BONES
turns.text: It's new -- have you any idea what you're saying?

turns.speaker: SPOCK
turns.text: I was not attempting to evaluate its moral implications, Doctor. As a matter of cosmic history, it has always been easier to destroy than to create --

turns.speaker: BONES
turns.text: Not anymore! Now you can do both at the same time! According to myth, the earth was created in six days. Watch out: here comes Genesis; we'll do it for you in six minutes --

turns.speaker: SPOCK
turns.text: I don't dispute that in the wrong hands --

turns.speaker: BONES
turns.text: Would you like to tell me whose are the <u>right</u> hands, my cold-blooded friend? Are you in favor of these experiments?

turns.speaker: BONES
turns.text: Are you out of your Vulcan mind? No human can tolerate the radiation loose in there!

turns.speaker: SPOCK
turns.text: But, as you are so fond of observing, Doctor, I'm not human.

turns.speaker: BONES
turns.text: You're not going in there -- !

turns.speaker: SPOCK
turns.text: I'm afraid I can't stop to discuss this logically --

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: Physician, heal thyself.

turns.speaker: BONES
turns.text: That's all you have to say?

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: I'm not a drama critic.

turns.speaker: BONES
turns.text: Wouldn't it be easier to put an experienced crew back on the ship?

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: They'll learn. Galloping about the cosmos is a game for the young, doctor.

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: Bless me, doctor; and what beams you into this neck of the woods?

turns.speaker: BONES
turns.text: 'Beware Romulans bearing gifts.' Happy Birthday...

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: Romulan Ale! Bones, you know this stuff is illegal --

turns.speaker: BONES
turns.text: I only use it for medicinal purposes. Don't be a pring...

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: Twenty-two, eighty-three...

turns.speaker: BONES
turns.text: Takes the stuff a while to ferment. Gimme.

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: I'm almost afraid to. What did you bring me, contraband Klingon --

turns.speaker: BONES
turns.text: More antiques for your collection -- Cheers!

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: Cheers. Bones, these are... charming.

turns.speaker: BONES
turns.text: Four hundred years old. You don't find many with the lens still intact.

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: Uh -- what are they?

turns.speaker: BONES
turns.text: For your eyes. For most patients of your age, I generally administer Retlax Five to restore flexibility of the lens.

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: But I'm allergic to Retlax.

turns.speaker: BONES
turns.text: Exactly. Happy birthday.

turns.speaker: BONES
turns.text: Slide them down your nose. Now look at me over the top. And you read printed matter through the bottom.

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: Amazing! I don't know what to say --

turns.speaker: BONES
turns.text: Say thank you.

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: Thank you.

turns.speaker: BONES
turns.text: Damn it, Jim, what the hell's the matter? Other people have birthdays. Why're we treating yours like a funeral?

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: Bones, I don't want to be lectured.

turns.speaker: BONES
turns.text: What DO you want? Damn it, why isn't there a girl here? You know this has nothing to do with age. This is about you flying a goddamn computer console when you wanna be out hopping Galaxies.

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: Spare me your notions of poetry, please. We all have our assigned duties and...

turns.speaker: BONES
turns.text: Bull. You're hiding -- hiding behind the rules and regulations --

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: And who am I hiding from?

turns.speaker: BONES
turns.text: From yourself, Admiral.

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: Don't mince words, Bones; tell me what you really think.

turns.speaker: BONES
turns.text: I'm your doctor and I'm your friend, Jim. Get back your command. Get it back before you really do grow old. Before you turn into part of this collection.

turns.speaker: BONES
turns.text: Shore leave, Admiral.

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: Ah.

turns.speaker: BONES
turns.text: What about the rest of the inspection, Admiral?

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: The inspection will continue once we're underway, Doctor.

turns.speaker: BONES
turns.text: It never rains but when it pours --

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: As a physician you of all people should appreciate the danger of re-opening old wounds.

turns.speaker: BONES
turns.text: I've got the sick bay ready. Will someone please tell me what is going on?

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: Computer. Request security procedure and access to Project Genesis Summary.

turns.speaker: BONES
turns.text: Doctors lose patients sometimes. Damn. I'm <u>still</u> in the dark: How'd he know about Genesis?

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: At the moment that question takes a back seat to preventing him from laying his hands on it. You said it yourself; we're talking about a bang that would re-arrange the universe...

turns.speaker: BONES
turns.text: There may still be time... you gave as good as you got.

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: I got beat. We're only alive because I knew something about these ships that he didn't.

turns.speaker: BONES
turns.text: Khan could be down there!

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: He's BEEN there and hasn't found what he wants. Can you spare someone? There may be people hurt.

turns.speaker: BONES
turns.text: I can spare me...

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: They even killed the galley chief.

turns.speaker: BONES
turns.text: This one looks like a Steward. They're not warm, but rigor hasn't set in. This didn't happen all that long ago, Jim.

turns.speaker: BONES
turns.text: Go? <u>Where</u> are we going?

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: Where <u>they</u> went. Saavik.

turns.speaker: BONES
turns.text: But what if they went -- nowhere?

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: Then this will be your big chance to get away from it all.

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: Do you have anything to eat? I don't know about anyone else, but I'm starved.

turns.speaker: BONES
turns.text: How can you think of food at a time like this?

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: Our first order of business is survival.

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: Now that's what I call a meal.

turns.speaker: BONES
turns.text: It's like the Garden of Eden...

turns.speaker: BONES
turns.text: Lieutenant, you are looking at the only Starfleet cadet who ever beat the no-win scenario --

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: And almost got tossed out of the Academy...

turns.speaker: BONES
turns.text: Until now.

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: We each face death every day we're alive, Saavik.

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: Hours instead of days, Saavik; now we have minutes instead of hours --

turns.speaker: BONES
turns.text: I'm taking this bunch to sick bay.

turns.speaker: BONES
turns.text: You okay, Jim? How do you feel?

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: Young. I feel young, Doctor.

turns.speaker: CHEKOV
turns.text: ... come in, please. This is Reliant calling Regula I. Repeat. This is USS Reliant --

turns.speaker: CAROL
turns.text: Commander, we are receiving. This is Regula I. Go ahead.

turns.speaker: CHEKOV
turns.text: Dr. Marcus... good. We're en route to you and should be there in three days.

turns.speaker: CAROL
turns.text: En route? Why? We weren't expecting you for another three months. Has something happened?  <u>Has something happened</u>? Do you read us?

turns.speaker: CHEKOV
turns.text: All went well. Nothing has happened. Ceti Alpha VI has checked out.

turns.speaker: CAROL
turns.text: I still don't under --

turns.speaker: CHEKOV
turns.text: We have received new orders. Upon our arrival at Regula I, all materials of Project Genesis will be transferred to this ship for immediate testing at Ceti Alpha VI.

turns.speaker: CAROL
turns.text: <u>Will you please be quiet</u>!  Commander Chekov, this is completely irregular. Who gave the order you are quoting? Who gave the order?

turns.speaker: CHEKOV
turns.text: The order comes from Starfleet command, Dr. Marcus, direct from the General Staff.

turns.speaker: CAROL
turns.text: But Genesis is a civilian project, under my control --

turns.speaker: CHEKOV
turns.text: I have my orders.

turns.speaker: CAROL
turns.text: This is completely improper, Commander Chekov. I have no intention of allowing Reliant or any other unauthorized personnel access to our work or materials.

turns.speaker: CHEKOV
turns.text: I'm sorry you feel that way, Doctor. Admiral Kirk's orders are confirmed. Please prepare to deliver Genesis to us upon our arrival. Reliant out.

turns.speaker: CAROL
turns.text: Jim... read me? Can you read me?

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: Message breaking up, Carol. What's wrong? What's wrong?

turns.speaker: CAROL
turns.text: ... Can't read you... repeat...

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: Repeat... what's wrong? What's wrong?

turns.speaker: CAROL
turns.text: ... taking Genesis away from us...

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: Taking Genesis? Who? Who is taking Genesis?

turns.speaker: CAROL
turns.text: ... see you but can't hear. Did you... order...?

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: What order? Who's taking Genesis?

turns.speaker: CAROL
turns.text: ... Please help us, Jim... won't let them have... without proper... repeat... on whose authority...

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: Carol!

turns.speaker: CAROL
turns.text: Jim please --

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: Wait --

turns.speaker: CAROL
turns.text: Stage One of our experiments was conducted in the labora- tory. Stage Two of the series will be attempted in a lifeless underground; Stage Three will involve the process on a plane- tary scale. What follows is a computer projected simulation of Stage Three. Please watch closely.

turns.speaker: CAROL
turns.text: David was right, wasn't he? It's just to keep them busy.

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: Why? Why didn't you tell me?

turns.speaker: CAROL
turns.text: How can you ask me that? Were we together? Where we going to be? You had your world and I had mine. I wanted him in mine, not chasing through the universe with his father.

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: You did this -- in a day?!

turns.speaker: CAROL
turns.text: The matrix formed in a day. The life forms grew later -- at a wildly accelerated rate. Can I cook or can't I?

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: It is a far far better thing I do than I have ever done before... a far better resting place I go to than I have ever known...

turns.speaker: CAROL
turns.text: Is that a poem?

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: Something Spock was trying to tell me. On my birthday.

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: How can you let them pull that stuff on you? They're just lazy.

turns.speaker: CAROL
turns.text: And bored. I know. But maybe it IS something they can...

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: Come on, Mother, that's just the military mentality. Never put off tomorrow what you can put off today. If there's one atom of life...

turns.speaker: CAROL
turns.text: I know, I know...

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: Well, don't have kittens. Genesis is going to work. They'll remember  you in a wreath with Newton, Einstein, Surak...

turns.speaker: CAROL
turns.text: Thanks a lot. No respect from my offspring --

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: Par for the course... you teaming up with me for bridge after dinner?

turns.speaker: CAROL
turns.text: Maybe...

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: Every time we have dealings with Starfleet, I get nervous.  We're dealing with something that COULD be perverted into a dreadful weapon. Remember that overgrown boy scout you used to hang out with? That's exactly the --

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: Does that about do it?

turns.speaker: CAROL
turns.text: I don't think there's another piece of information we could squeeze into the memory banks. Next time, we'll design a bigger one.

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: Who --

turns.speaker: CAROL
turns.text: Will you please be quiet! We must have order here.  This has to be some sort of mistake.

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: Mistake? We're all alone here. They waited until everyone was on shift-leave to do this. Reliant is supposed to be at our disposal, not vice-versa.

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: I've tried to warn you. Scientists are always pawns of the military --

turns.speaker: CAROL
turns.text: Starfleet has kept the peace for a hundred years, I cannot and will not subscribe to your interpretation of this event.

turns.speaker: CAROL
turns.text: David --

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: Mother, go back!

turns.speaker: CAROL
turns.text: Jim --

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: Go back. I'm going to kill him.

turns.speaker: CAROL
turns.text: You do that and you'll have murdered your father.

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: So are we, it looks like.

turns.speaker: CAROL
turns.text: I don't understand. Who's responsible for all this? Who is Khan?

turns.speaker: CAROL
turns.text: This? It took the Starfleet corps of engineers ten months in space suits to tunnel out all this. What we did in there -- we did in a day. David, why don't you show Dr. McCoy and the Lieutenant our idea of food.

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: But we can't just sit here -- !

turns.speaker: CAROL
turns.text: David. Please.

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: This is just to give us something to do, isn't it?  Come on.

turns.speaker: TERRELL
turns.text: Don't tell me you've got something.

turns.speaker: CHEKOV
turns.text: We've picked up a minor energy flux reading on one dyno scanner.

turns.speaker: TERRELL
turns.text: Damn! Are you sure? Maybe the scanner's out of adjustment --

turns.speaker: CHEKOV
turns.text: I suppose it <u>could</u> be a particle of preanimate matter caught in the matrix...

turns.speaker: TERRELL
turns.text: All right, let's get on the Comm-pic to Doctor Marcus. Maybe it's something we can transplant.

turns.speaker: CHEKOV
turns.text: You know what she'll say...

turns.speaker: TERRELL
turns.text: Are you sure these are the coordinates?

turns.speaker: CHEKOV
turns.text: Captain, this is the garden spot of Ceti Alpha VI --

turns.speaker: TERRELL
turns.text: I can hardly see --

turns.speaker: TERRELL
turns.text: You're crazy -- !

turns.speaker: CHEKOV
turns.text: I saw it -- !

turns.speaker: TERRELL
turns.text: There's an air-lock.

turns.speaker: CHEKOV
turns.text: I told you! I told you I saw a --

turns.speaker: TERRELL
turns.text: Ssssh!

turns.speaker: CHEKOV
turns.text: <u>Botany Bay</u> -- oh no!

turns.speaker: TERRELL
turns.text: What's the matter -- ?

turns.speaker: TERRELL
turns.text: But the child --

turns.speaker: CHEKOV
turns.text: Never mind! Hurry!

turns.speaker: CHEKOV
turns.text: A criminal, Captain -- a product of the late 20th Century genetic engineering --

turns.speaker: TERRELL
turns.text: What do you want with us? I demand --

turns.speaker: CHEKOV
turns.text: He left us.  We were no longer of use. SAAVIK Where is  the Reliant crew? Dead?

turns.speaker: TERRELL
turns.text: Marooned on Ceti Alpha V. He's completely mad, Admiral. He blames you for the death of his wife...

turns.speaker: CHEKOV
turns.text: You lie! On Ceti Alpha V there was life, a fair chance to --

turns.speaker: KHAN
turns.text: <u>This is Ceti Alpha V</u>! Ceti Alpha VI exploded six months after we were left here. The shock shifted the orbit of <u>this</u> planet and everything was laid waste. <u>Admiral</u> Kirk never bothered to check on our progress. It was only the fact of my genetically engineered intellect that enabled us to survive! On earth, two hundred years ago, I was a prince, with power over millions -- now, like Prometheus I have been left by Admiral Kirk to digest my own entrails.

turns.speaker: CHEKOV
turns.text: Captain Kirk was your host! You repaid his hospitality by trying to steal his ship and murder him.

turns.speaker: KHAN
turns.text: And I'll wager he never told you about his shipmate, the beautiful and courageous Lieutenant McGiver, who gave up everything to join me in exile. OUT OF LOVE. And see how <u>Admiral Kirk</u> requited her devotion -- She's dead as earth!

turns.speaker: CHEKOV
turns.text: Khan, listen to me! Captain Kirk was only doing his duty! You --

turns.speaker: KHAN
turns.text: There is some pain at first, I am told, and then the effects are quite benign -- until the end. That was what I learned from watching my wife.

turns.speaker: CHEKOV
turns.text: Beyond what I told you, sir, it is classified information.

turns.speaker: KHAN
turns.text: Umm. And would Admiral Kirk have access to such information?

turns.speaker: CHEKOV
turns.text: I would think so, sir. He's on the Fleet General Staff.

turns.speaker: KHAN
turns.text: Then to whom do you report directly regarding Genesis?

turns.speaker: CHEKOV
turns.text: To Doctor Marcus, the civilian director of the experiments on Space Laboratory Regula I.

turns.speaker: KHAN
turns.text: I see. Helmsman?

turns.speaker: KHAN
turns.text: Well done, Commander.

turns.speaker: CHEKOV
turns.text: You realize, sir, that they will attempt to contact Admiral Kirk and confirm the order.

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: I'm Admiral Kirk...

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: <u>We were still there</u>, you dumb bastard! We could hear the screams all the way to the transporter room --

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: Where's Dr. Marcus --

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: I'm Doctor Marcus!

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: Why didn't you tell me?

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: She's making it up! My father was Professor --

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: It's a long story.

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: We appear to have plenty of time.

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: It's the Genesis Wave!

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: He's on a build up to detonation!

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: How soon --

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: We encoded four minutes --

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: We'll beam aboard and stop it --

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: You can't!

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: I don't mean to intrude.

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: Uh, no...  I should be on the bridge.

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: Are you running away from me?

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: I suppose I was.  I poured a drink. Would you like it?

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: No. I -- I guess I'm not what you expected.

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: I didn't expect anything.

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: That makes two of us.  Lieutenant Saavik was right: you never have faced death --

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: Not like this -- no. I haven't faced death, I cheated death. I tricked my way out of death and patted myself on the back for my ingenuity. I know nothing.

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: You knew enough to tell Saavik that how we face death is at least as important as how we face life --

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: It was just words.

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: But good words. That's where ideas begin. Maybe you should listen to them.

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: I'm trying, David.

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: So am I. My friends were killed, too.

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: I am truly sorry.

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: I was wrong about you. And <u>I'm</u> sorry.

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: Is that what you came here to say?

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: Mainly.  And also that I'm proud -- very proud -- to be your son.

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: Let go -- he can't -- !

turns.speaker: SAAVIK
turns.text: Only half of you would get there.

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: What are you looking at?

turns.speaker: SAAVIK
turns.text: The Admiral's son.

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: Don't you believe it.

turns.speaker: SAAVIK
turns.text: Oh, I believe it.

turns.speaker: SAAVIK
turns.text: What are <u>you</u> looking at?

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: I don't know.

turns.speaker: JOACHIM
turns.text: Steady on course. All systems normal.

turns.speaker: KHAN
turns.text: It's not much different from Enterprise.  When I was a guest aboard her some years ago, Captain Kirk kindly allowed me to memorize her technical manuals. And now, Mr. Chekov, let us review: You say you have no details of Project 'Genesis' ?

turns.speaker: JOACHIM
turns.text: They're requesting visual communications, sir.

turns.speaker: KHAN
turns.text: Let them eat static.

turns.speaker: JOACHIM
turns.text: They're still running with shields down.

turns.speaker: KHAN
turns.text: Of course. We're one big happy fleet. Ah, Kirk, my old friend, do you know the Klingon proverb that tells us revenge is a dish that is best served cold?  It is very cold in space.

turns.speaker: KHAN
turns.text: Careful: Not all at once. <u>The</u> <u>engine room</u>. Lock on target and prepare to fire.

turns.speaker: JOACHIM
turns.text: Locking phasers on target.

turns.speaker: JOACHIM
turns.text: Sir -- our shields are dropping!

turns.speaker: KHAN
turns.text: Raise them --

turns.speaker: JOACHIM
turns.text: They won't --

turns.speaker: KHAN
turns.text: <u>Where's the over-ride</u>??

turns.speaker: KHAN
turns.text: At them! At them! FIRE! FIRE! Why can't you?

turns.speaker: JOACHIM
turns.text: We can't fire, sir; they've damaged the photon controls and the warp drive. We must withdraw!

turns.speaker: KHAN
turns.text: No!

turns.speaker: JOACHIM
turns.text: Sir, we must!  We must repair the damage. Enterprise will wait; she's not going anywhere.

turns.speaker: KHAN
turns.text: Well?

turns.speaker: JOACHIM
turns.text: Warp drive still inoperative. All other systems should be restored shortly.

turns.speaker: JOACHIM
turns.text: Departing dark side, Regula.

turns.speaker: KHAN
turns.text: Visual --

turns.speaker: JOACHIM
turns.text: We'll lose them if they go in there.

turns.speaker: KHAN
turns.text: Rake her.

turns.speaker: JOACHIM
turns.text: No sir! We have Genesis -- Whatever you want --

turns.speaker: KHAN
turns.text: <u>Full power damn you</u>!
